sigmund-livingston.name: Sigmund Livingston
sigmund-livingston.bio: American attorney and founder of the Anti-Defamation League (ADL) in 1913. Born 1872, Jewish family in Bloomington, Illinois. Established the ADL in response to antisemitism, particularly the Leo Frank case. Served as ADL national chair until 1946.

jeff-zucker.bio: Former CNN president (2013-2022). Previously CEO of NBCUniversal.

les-moonves.name: Les Moonves
les-moonves.bio: Former chairman and CEO of CBS Corporation.

ariel-muzicant.name: Ariel Muzicant
ariel-muzicant.bio: Austrian-Israeli businessman, VP of the European Jewish Congress.

henry-lehman.name: Henry Lehman
henry-lehman.bio: German-Jewish immigrant who co-founded Lehman Brothers.

alan-greenberg.name: Alan Greenberg
alan-greenberg.bio: Long-time Jewish CEO of Bear Stearns.

jacob-schiff.name: Jacob Schiff
jacob-schiff.bio: Jewish financier and philanthropist who led Kuhn Loeb to prominence.

daniel-och.name: Daniel Och
daniel-och.bio: Jewish founder of Och-Ziff Capital Management.

steven-a-cohen.name: Steven A. Cohen
steven-a-cohen.bio: Jewish billionaire hedge fund manager, owner of the NY Mets.

daniel-loeb.name: Daniel Loeb
daniel-loeb.bio: Jewish activist investor and hedge fund manager.

carl-icahn.name: Carl Icahn
carl-icahn.bio: Jewish billionaire activist investor and corporate raider.

marcus-goldman.name: Marcus Goldman
marcus-goldman.bio: Bavarian-Jewish immigrant who founded Goldman Sachs.

samuel-sachs.name: Samuel Sachs
samuel-sachs.bio: Jewish co-founder and son-in-law of Marcus Goldman.

stephen-schwarzman.name: Stephen Schwarzman
stephen-schwarzman.bio: Jewish billionaire, co-founder of Blackstone, major philanthropist.

jonathan-gray.name: Jonathan Gray
jonathan-gray.bio: Jewish president and COO of Blackstone.

john-janick.name: John Janick
john-janick.bio: Jewish chairman and CEO of Interscope Geffen A&M Records.

herb-alpert.name: Herb Alpert
herb-alpert.bio: Jewish musician and co-founder of A&M Records.

lucian-grainge.name: Lucian Grainge
lucian-grainge.bio: British-Jewish music executive, CEO of Universal Music Group.

clive-davis.name: Clive Davis
clive-davis.bio: Jewish music executive who discovered Whitney Houston, Alicia Keys, and many others.

bennett-cerf.name: Bennett Cerf
bennett-cerf.bio: Jewish publisher and co-founder of Random House.

alfred-a-knopf.name: Alfred A. Knopf
alfred-a-knopf.bio: Jewish publisher known for literary quality.

richard-robinson.name: Richard Robinson
richard-robinson.bio: Jewish longtime chairman of Scholastic Corporation.

warren-eisenberg.name: Warren Eisenberg
warren-eisenberg.bio: Jewish co-founder of Bed Bath & Beyond.

leonard-feinstein.name: Leonard Feinstein
leonard-feinstein.bio: Jewish co-founder of Bed Bath & Beyond.

isidor-straus.name: Isidor Straus
isidor-straus.bio: Jewish co-owner of Macy's who perished on the Titanic.

nathan-straus.name: Nathan Straus
nathan-straus.bio: Jewish co-owner. Major philanthropist, supported pasteurized milk for children.

stanley-marcus.name: Stanley Marcus
stanley-marcus.bio: Jewish retail visionary who made Neiman Marcus a global luxury brand.

julius-rosenwald.name: Julius Rosenwald
julius-rosenwald.bio: Jewish businessman who built Sears into a retail giant. Major philanthropist who funded schools for African Americans.

stan-lee.name: Stan Lee
stan-lee.bio: Born Stanley Lieber. Jewish comic book writer who co-created Spider-Man, X-Men, and many others.

jack-kirby.name: Jack Kirby
jack-kirby.bio: Born Jacob Kurtzberg. Jewish comic book artist who co-created Captain America, Hulk, Fantastic Four.

bob-kane.name: Bob Kane
bob-kane.bio: Born Robert Kahn. Jewish co-creator of Batman.

louis-b-mayer.name: Louis B. Mayer
louis-b-mayer.bio: Jewish film mogul who co-founded Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer.

samuel-goldwyn.name: Samuel Goldwyn
samuel-goldwyn.bio: Born Szmuel Gelbfisz. Jewish film producer.

adolph-zukor.name: Adolph Zukor
adolph-zukor.bio: Hungarian-Jewish immigrant (1873-1976). Founded Paramount Pictures. Lived to 103.

harry-cohn.name: Harry Cohn
harry-cohn.bio: Jewish co-founder and longtime president of Columbia Pictures.

carl-laemmle.name: Carl Laemmle
carl-laemmle.bio: German-Jewish immigrant who founded Universal Pictures.

william-fox.name: William Fox
william-fox.bio: Hungarian-born Jewish founder of Fox Film Corporation.

marc-randolph.name: Marc Randolph
marc-randolph.bio: Jewish co-founder and first CEO of Netflix.

johny-srouji.name: Johny Srouji
johny-srouji.bio: Israeli-Arab VP at Apple who leads chip design, partly in Israel.

navot-volk.name: Navot Volk
navot-volk.bio: Israeli GM leading Amazon's Annapurna Labs chip development.

nir-zuk.name: Nir Zuk
nir-zuk.bio: Israeli co-founder of Palo Alto Networks, previously co-developed the first stateful inspection firewall at Check Point.

dmitri-alperovitch.name: Dmitri Alperovitch
dmitri-alperovitch.bio: Russian-born Jewish-American cybersecurity expert, co-founder of CrowdStrike.

danny-lewin.name: Danny Lewin
danny-lewin.bio: Israeli-American mathematician and co-founder of Akamai. First victim of the 9/11 attacks.

eli-hurvitz.name: Eli Hurvitz
eli-hurvitz.bio: Israeli businessman who led Teva's global expansion for decades.

tal-zaks.name: Tal Zaks
tal-zaks.bio: Israeli physician-scientist who served as Moderna's Chief Medical Officer during COVID-19 vaccine development.

michael-dowling.name: Michael Dowling
michael-dowling.bio: CEO of Northwell Health, partner of Israeli medical innovations.

mark-davis.name: Mark Davis
mark-davis.bio: Owner of the Las Vegas Raiders. His mother Carol was Jewish.

marc-lore.name: Marc Lore
marc-lore.bio: Jewish entrepreneur, former CEO of Walmart eCommerce.

marc-lasry.name: Marc Lasry
marc-lasry.bio: Moroccan-born Jewish billionaire hedge fund manager.

tony-ressler.name: Tony Ressler
tony-ressler.bio: Jewish billionaire co-founder of Ares Management.

mat-ishbia.name: Mat Ishbia
mat-ishbia.bio: Jewish billionaire, CEO of United Wholesale Mortgage, owner of the Phoenix Suns.

dan-gilbert.name: Dan Gilbert
dan-gilbert.bio: Jewish billionaire, founder of Quicken Loans and owner of the Cleveland Cavaliers.

wyc-grousbeck.name: Wyc Grousbeck
wyc-grousbeck.bio: Jewish lead owner and governor of the Boston Celtics.

tom-dundon.name: Tom Dundon
tom-dundon.bio: Jewish majority owner of the Carolina Hurricanes.

jeff-vinik.name: Jeff Vinik
jeff-vinik.bio: Jewish billionaire owner of the Tampa Bay Lightning.

david-simon.name: David Simon
david-simon.bio: Chairman, CEO, and President of Simon Property Group. Son of co-founder Melvin Simon.

ric-clark.name: Ric Clark
ric-clark.bio: Jewish former chairman of Brookfield Property Partners.

william-mack.name: William Mack
william-mack.bio: Jewish real estate developer who co-founded Mack-Cali Realty.

william-rudin.name: William Rudin
william-rudin.bio: Jewish CEO of Rudin Management Company.

douglas-durst.name: Douglas Durst
douglas-durst.bio: Jewish chairman of The Durst Organization.

nathan-handwerker.name: Nathan Handwerker
nathan-handwerker.bio: Polish-Jewish immigrant who founded Nathan's Famous hot dogs on Coney Island.

daniel-lubetzky.name: Daniel Lubetzky
daniel-lubetzky.bio: Jewish-American founder of Kind Snacks, son of a Holocaust survivor.

shaul-elovitch.name: Shaul Elovitch
shaul-elovitch.bio: Israeli businessman, former controlling shareholder of Bezeq.

nochi-dankner.name: Nochi Dankner
nochi-dankner.bio: Israeli businessman who controlled Cellcom through IDB Holdings.

pinhas-rutenberg.name: Pinhas Rutenberg
pinhas-rutenberg.bio: Russian-Jewish Zionist who founded the Palestine Electric Corporation.

yitzhak-tshuva.name: Yitzhak Tshuva
yitzhak-tshuva.bio: Israeli billionaire, chairman of Delek Group.

david-azrieli.name: David Azrieli
david-azrieli.bio: Canadian-Israeli billionaire who built the Azrieli Towers.

lev-leviev.name: Lev Leviev
lev-leviev.bio: Uzbek-born Israeli diamond and real estate magnate.

leon-recanati.name: Leon Recanati
leon-recanati.bio: Israeli businessman from the prominent Recanati Jewish banking family.

shlomo-barak.name: Shlomo Barak
shlomo-barak.bio: Israeli CEO who led Orbotech through its acquisition by KLA.

doron-myersdorf.name: Doron Myersdorf
doron-myersdorf.bio: Israeli founder and CEO of StoreDot.

omer-keilaf.name: Omer Keilaf
omer-keilaf.bio: Israeli co-founder and CEO of Innoviz Technologies.

daniel-barel.name: Daniel Barel
daniel-barel.bio: Israeli co-founder and CEO of REE Automotive.

gavriel-iddan.name: Gavriel Iddan
gavriel-iddan.bio: Israeli engineer who invented the PillCam capsule endoscopy.

idan-ofer.name: Idan Ofer
idan-ofer.bio: Israeli billionaire, controlling shareholder of ICL through Israel Corp.

edmond-de-rothschild.name: Edmond de Rothschild
edmond-de-rothschild.bio: Jewish French banker who funded early Jewish settlements and wineries in Palestine.

eliezer-manor.name: Eliezer Manor
eliezer-manor.bio: Israeli businessman who led Ahava's global expansion.

avi-nir.name: Avi Nir
avi-nir.bio: Israeli CEO of Keshet Media Group.

amos-regev.name: Amos Regev
amos-regev.bio: Israeli journalist and CEO of Channel 13.

matthew-freud.name: Matthew Freud
matthew-freud.bio: British PR executive, great-grandson of Sigmund Freud.

maurice-saatchi.name: Maurice Saatchi
maurice-saatchi.bio: Iraqi-Jewish co-founder of Saatchi & Saatchi. Now Baron Saatchi.

martin-sorrell.name: Martin Sorrell
martin-sorrell.bio: Jewish British businessman who founded and built WPP into the world's largest ad company.

israel-sieff.name: Israel Sieff
israel-sieff.bio: Jewish businessman and Zionist who led M&S for decades.

maurice-l-vy.name: Maurice Lévy
maurice-l-vy.bio: Jewish chairman, led Publicis for decades.

marcel-dassault.name: Marcel Dassault
marcel-dassault.bio: Born Marcel Bloch, Jewish French aviation pioneer and industrialist.

serge-dassault.name: Serge Dassault
serge-dassault.bio: Son of Marcel, ran the Dassault empire.

hubert-sagni-res.name: Hubert Sagnières
hubert-sagni-res.bio: Former CEO of Essilor who expanded Israeli partnerships.

gunter-demnig.name: Gunter Demnig
gunter-demnig.bio: German artist who created the Stolpersteine project.

peter-munk.name: Peter Munk
peter-munk.bio: Hungarian-born Canadian Jewish mining magnate, founder of Barrick Gold.

affiliations.organization: Munk School of Global Affairs (U of Toronto)

anthony-pratt.name: Anthony Pratt
anthony-pratt.bio: Jewish Australian billionaire, chairman of Visy Industries and Pratt Industries.

harry-oppenheimer.name: Harry Oppenheimer
harry-oppenheimer.bio: Jewish South African, son of Ernest, led Anglo American and De Beers.

vicky-safra.name: Vicky Safra
vicky-safra.bio: Jewish widow of Joseph Safra, one of the world's richest women.

arkady-volozh.name: Arkady Volozh
arkady-volozh.bio: Kazakh-born Jewish co-founder of Yandex. Now based in Israel.

david-sassoon.name: David Sassoon
david-sassoon.bio: Baghdadi Jewish businessman who established a vast trade empire in India.

rabbi-nachman-of-breslov.name: Rabbi Nachman of Breslov
rabbi-nachman-of-breslov.bio: Hasidic master buried in Uman, Ukraine.

chiune-sugihara.name: Chiune Sugihara
chiune-sugihara.bio: Japanese diplomat who issued visas saving thousands of Jews.

houda-nonoo.name: Houda Nonoo
houda-nonoo.bio: Jewish Bahraini woman who served as Bahrain's ambassador to the US.

raoul-wallenberg.name: Raoul Wallenberg
raoul-wallenberg.bio: Swedish diplomat who saved tens of thousands of Hungarian Jews.

daniel-libeskind.name: Daniel Libeskind
daniel-libeskind.bio: Jewish-Polish-American architect who designed the museum.

sigmund-freud.name: Sigmund Freud
sigmund-freud.bio: Austrian Jewish neurologist who founded psychoanalysis.

donniel-hartman.name: Donniel Hartman
donniel-hartman.bio: Jewish philosopher and president of the Hartman Institute.

affiliations.organization: Shalom Hartman Institute of North America

david-ellison.name: David Ellison
david-ellison.bio: David Ellison (Jewish), son of Oracle founder Larry Ellison, founded Skydance Media. Paramount agreed to merge with Skydance in 2024.

steven-mnuchin.name: Steven Mnuchin
steven-mnuchin.bio: Steven Mnuchin (Jewish) was a Goldman Sachs partner before serving as US Treasury Secretary 2017-2021.

affiliations.role: Former Goldman Partner & US Treasury Secretary

max-lousada.name: Max Lousada
max-lousada.bio: Leads Warner Music's global recorded music operations.

andrew-viterbi.name: Andrew Viterbi
andrew-viterbi.bio: Andrew Viterbi (Jewish, Italian-born), co-founder of Qualcomm. Invented the Viterbi algorithm used in cellular networks, WiFi, and space communications. The Viterbi School of Engineering at USC bears his name.

ilya-sutskever.name: Ilya Sutskever
ilya-sutskever.bio: Ilya Sutskever (Jewish), born in Russia, raised in Israel. Co-founded OpenAI and was chief scientist. Pioneer of deep learning, student of Geoffrey Hinton. Left OpenAI in 2024 to found Safe Superintelligence Inc.

jacob-blaustein.name: Jacob Blaustein
jacob-blaustein.bio: Industrialist and philanthropist who served as AJC president (1949-1954). Negotiated the historic Blaustein-Ben-Gurion Agreement defining US Jewish-Israel relations.

abraham-foxman.name: Abraham Foxman
abraham-foxman.bio: National Director of the ADL from 1987 to 2015. Holocaust survivor born in Poland, saved by his Catholic nanny during WWII.

amy-spitalnick.name: Amy Spitalnick
amy-spitalnick.bio: CEO of JCPA. Previously served as executive director of Integrity First for America, which won a landmark case against white supremacist organizers of the Charlottesville rally.

marvin-hier.name: Marvin Hier
marvin-hier.bio: Founder and Dean of the Simon Wiesenthal Center since 1977. Rabbi Hier built the organization into a global force for Holocaust remembrance and tolerance education.

rabbi-noah-farkas.name: Rabbi Noah Farkas
rabbi-noah-farkas.bio: President and CEO of the Jewish Federation of Greater Los Angeles since 2021. Previously served as senior rabbi of Valley Beth Shalom.

affiliations.organization: Jewish Federation of Greater Los Angeles

lonnie-nasatir.name: Lonnie Nasatir
lonnie-nasatir.bio: President of the Jewish United Fund and Jewish Federation of Metropolitan Chicago. Previously led Jewish community organizations in Detroit.

affiliations.organization: Jewish United Fund of Metropolitan Chicago

daniel-s-mariaschin.name: Daniel S. Mariaschin
daniel-s-mariaschin.bio: CEO of B'nai B'rith International. Has led the organization's international advocacy, including engagement at the UN and with world leaders.

solomon-schechter.name: Solomon Schechter
solomon-schechter.bio: Romanian-born rabbi and scholar who founded the United Synagogue in 1913 and led JTS. Discovered the Cairo Genizah, one of the greatest manuscript finds in history.

rick-jacobs.name: Rick Jacobs
rick-jacobs.bio: President of the URJ since 2012. Previously senior rabbi of Westchester Reform Temple. Leads the largest Jewish denominational organization in North America.

joseph-soloveitchik.name: Joseph Soloveitchik
joseph-soloveitchik.bio: Known as 'The Rav,' Rabbi Soloveitchik (1903-1993) was the towering intellectual figure of Modern Orthodoxy and trained thousands of RCA rabbis at Yeshiva University.

sally-priesand.name: Sally Priesand
sally-priesand.bio: First woman ordained as a rabbi in America (1972, HUC-JIR). Pioneer who opened the rabbinate to women across all Jewish denominations.

affiliations.role: First Female Rabbi Ordained in America

henrietta-szold.name: Henrietta Szold
henrietta-szold.bio: Founded Hadassah in 1912 and directed Youth Aliyah, rescuing thousands of Jewish children from Nazi Europe. Considered one of the most important women in Jewish and Zionist history.

affiliations.organization: Hadassah, The Women's Zionist Organization of America

abraham-cahan.name: Abraham Cahan
abraham-cahan.bio: Lithuanian-Jewish immigrant (1860-1951) who served as editor of the Forward for 50 years (1903-1951). Under his leadership, the Forward became the largest non-English newspaper in America. A giant of Yiddish journalism and literature.

jacob-landau.name: Jacob Landau
jacob-landau.bio: Founded JTA in 1917, creating the first global Jewish news service. Modeled it on the Associated Press to provide reliable Jewish news worldwide.

norman-podhoretz.name: Norman Podhoretz
norman-podhoretz.bio: Editor of Commentary from 1960-1995. His ideological journey from liberalism to neoconservatism mirrored and influenced a generation of Jewish intellectuals. Author of 'Making It' and 'Breaking Ranks.'

elie-wiesel.name: Elie Wiesel
elie-wiesel.bio: Holocaust survivor, Nobel Peace Prize laureate (1986), author of 'Night,' and co-founder of Moment Magazine. Called the 'messenger to mankind' by the Nobel Committee.

affiliations.organization: Conference on Jewish Material Claims Against Germany (Claims Conference)
Elie Wiesel National Institute for the Study of the Holocaust in Romania

max-weinreich.name: Max Weinreich
max-weinreich.bio: Co-founder of YIVO (1925) and pioneering Yiddish linguist. Author of 'History of the Yiddish Language.' Coined the phrase 'a language is a dialect with an army and a navy.'

haskel-lookstein.name: Haskel Lookstein
haskel-lookstein.bio: Senior rabbi of Kehilath Jeshurun for decades. Led the Modern Orthodox movement in NYC. Converted Ivanka Trump to Judaism. Principal of the Ramaz School.

yuli-edelstein.name: Yuli Edelstein
yuli-edelstein.bio: Former Speaker of the Knesset (2013-2020). Born in Ukraine, was a Prisoner of Zion in the Soviet Union before making aliyah. Represented Likud.

meir-dagan.name: Meir Dagan
meir-dagan.bio: Director of the Mossad (2002-2011). Widely credited with reinvigorating Mossad's operational capabilities. Oversaw operations including efforts to sabotage Iran's nuclear program.

affiliations.organization: Mossad (Institute for Intelligence and Special Operations)

sir-mick-davis.name: Sir Mick Davis
sir-mick-davis.bio: Sir Mick Davis, South African-born British businessman (Jewish), former CEO of Xstrata mining, served as chairman of the Jewish Leadership Council and CEO of the UK Conservative Party.

sir-hermann-gollancz.name: Sir Hermann Gollancz
sir-hermann-gollancz.bio: Sir Hermann Gollancz (Jewish), rabbi and scholar, was a prominent leader in the United Synagogue movement in the early 20th century.

michael-goldstein.name: Michael Goldstein
michael-goldstein.bio: Michael Goldstein served as president of the United Synagogue, overseeing modernization efforts.

clive-lawton.name: Clive Lawton
clive-lawton.bio: Clive Lawton OBE (Jewish), educator and communal leader, was a co-founder of Limmud in 1980 and helped establish it as an international Jewish learning movement.

lord-levy.name: Lord Levy
lord-levy.bio: Lord Michael Levy (Jewish), Labour Party fundraiser and life peer, has served as president of Jewish Care and is one of its principal supporters.

sir-moses-montefiore.name: Sir Moses Montefiore
sir-moses-montefiore.bio: Sir Moses Montefiore (Jewish, 1784-1885), British financier, philanthropist, and Sheriff of London, was a pioneering figure in Jewish humanitarian relief efforts from Britain.

leopold-greenberg.name: Leopold Greenberg
leopold-greenberg.bio: Leopold Greenberg (Jewish, 1861-1931), editor of the Jewish Chronicle for 26 years, was a key Zionist leader and confidant of Theodor Herzl.

justin-cohen.name: Justin Cohen
justin-cohen.bio: Justin Cohen (Jewish), journalist and editor, has served as a senior editorial figure at the Jewish News, shaping its coverage of Anglo-Jewish affairs.

jonathan-boyd.name: Jonathan Boyd
jonathan-boyd.bio: Jonathan Boyd (Jewish), executive director of JPR, leads the institute's research programs on European Jewish demographics, identity, and antisemitism.

rabbi-leo-baeck.name: Rabbi Leo Baeck
rabbi-leo-baeck.bio: Rabbi Leo Baeck (Jewish, 1873-1956), German rabbi, theologian, and leader of Progressive Judaism, led the Reich Association of German Jews under Nazi rule and survived Theresienstadt concentration camp.

moses-angel.name: Moses Angel
moses-angel.bio: Moses Angel (Jewish, 1819-1898), headmaster of Jews' Free School for 50 years (1842-1897), transformed it into one of the largest schools in England with over 4,000 pupils.

alfred-wiener.name: Alfred Wiener
alfred-wiener.bio: Dr. Alfred Wiener (Jewish, 1885-1964), German-born librarian and activist, founded the Wiener Library in Amsterdam in 1933 to document Nazi antisemitism. The collection was moved to London in 1939 and used as evidence at Nuremberg.

sir-trevor-pears.name: Sir Trevor Pears
sir-trevor-pears.bio: Sir Trevor Pears CMG (Jewish), executive chair of the Pears Foundation and director of the William Pears Group property business, is one of the UK's leading Jewish philanthropists.

avi-shaked.name: Avi Shaked
avi-shaked.bio: Avi Shaked (Jewish, Israeli), co-founder of 888 Holdings, helped build one of the world's largest online gambling platforms from its origins in Israel.

sir-nicholas-winton.name: Sir Nicholas Winton
sir-nicholas-winton.bio: Sir Nicholas Winton (1909-2015), British humanitarian, organized the rescue of 669 mostly Jewish children from Nazi-occupied Czechoslovakia via the Kindertransport. His efforts were unknown until 1988.

francis-kalifat.name: Francis Kalifat
francis-kalifat.bio: Francis Kalifat (Jewish, French), served as president of CRIF, leading its advocacy against antisemitism and efforts to strengthen France-Israel relations.

affiliations.organization: CRIF (Conseil Représentatif des Institutions Juives de France)

grand-rabbi-ha-m-korsia.name: Grand Rabbi Haïm Korsia
grand-rabbi-ha-m-korsia.bio: Grand Rabbi Haïm Korsia (Jewish, born 1963), Chief Rabbi of France since 2014, represents French Jewry in interfaith and public affairs. Previously served as chaplain general of the French armed forces.

adolphe-cr-mieux.name: Adolphe Crémieux
adolphe-cr-mieux.bio: Adolphe Crémieux (Jewish, 1796-1880), French lawyer and statesman, co-founded the Alliance Israélite Universelle in 1860 and authored the Crémieux Decree granting French citizenship to Algerian Jews.

emmanuel-levinas.name: Emmanuel Levinas
emmanuel-levinas.bio: Emmanuel Levinas (Jewish, 1906-1995), Lithuanian-born French philosopher, was one of the most influential thinkers of the 20th century. His work on ethics, alterity, and the Talmud transformed Continental philosophy.

shimon-koffler-fogel.name: Shimon Koffler Fogel
shimon-koffler-fogel.bio: Shimon Koffler Fogel (Jewish), CEO of CIJA, has led the organization's advocacy efforts on behalf of the Canadian Jewish community, engaging with government and media.

affiliations.organization: Centre for Israel and Jewish Affairs (CIJA)
Centre for Israel and Jewish Affairs

avi-benlolo.name: Avi Benlolo
avi-benlolo.bio: Avi Benlolo (Jewish), founding president and CEO of Friends of Simon Wiesenthal Center for Holocaust Studies in Canada, led its growth into a major Holocaust education organization.

samuel-bronfman.name: Samuel Bronfman
samuel-bronfman.bio: Samuel Bronfman (Jewish, 1889-1971), founder of Seagram, served as president of the Canadian Jewish Congress for decades, using his wealth and influence to advance Jewish communal interests in Canada.

alex-ryvchin.name: Alex Ryvchin
alex-ryvchin.bio: Alex Ryvchin (Jewish), co-CEO of the ECAJ, is a prominent advocate for the Australian Jewish community and author of books on antisemitism and Zionism.

colin-rubenstein.name: Colin Rubenstein
colin-rubenstein.bio: Dr. Colin Rubenstein AM (Jewish), executive director of AIJAC, has led the organization for decades and is one of Australia's most prominent advocates for Israel and the Jewish community.

peter-eisenman.name: Peter Eisenman
peter-eisenman.bio: Peter Eisenman (Jewish, born 1932), American architect and theorist, designed Berlin's Memorial to the Murdered Jews of Europe. Known for his deconstructivist approach and intellectually challenging architectural designs.

affiliations.organization: Memorial to the Murdered Jews of Europe

yuri-kanner.name: Yuri Kanner
yuri-kanner.bio: Yuri Kanner (Jewish, Russian), president of the Russian Jewish Congress, leads efforts to promote Jewish cultural life, fight antisemitism, and strengthen Jewish identity in Russia.

wendy-kahn.name: Wendy Kahn
wendy-kahn.bio: Wendy Kahn (Jewish), national director of the SAJBD, leads the organization's advocacy, community relations, and anti-antisemitism efforts in South Africa.

affiliations.organization: South African Jewish Board of Deputies (SAJBD)

bernard-gillian-memory-gilligan.name: Bernard Gillian Memory Gilligan
bernard-gillian-memory-gilligan.bio: Jewish South African entrepreneurs founded Investec in 1974, which grew into a major international banking group.

rabbi-gavriel-holtzberg.name: Rabbi Gavriel Holtzberg
rabbi-gavriel-holtzberg.bio: Rabbi Gavriel Holtzberg (Jewish, Israeli, 1979-2008) and his wife Rivka ran Chabad Nariman House in Mumbai. Both were murdered during the 2008 Mumbai terrorist attacks.

alberto-nisman.name: Alberto Nisman
alberto-nisman.bio: Alberto Nisman (Jewish, 1963-2015), Argentine prosecutor, investigated the AMIA bombing for 10 years. Found dead with a gunshot wound in 2015, hours before he was to present evidence that President Cristina Kirchner covered up Iranian involvement.

rabbi-marshall-t-meyer.name: Rabbi Marshall T. Meyer
rabbi-marshall-t-meyer.bio: Rabbi Marshall T. Meyer (Jewish, American, 1930-1993), founder of the Seminario Rabínico Latinoamericano, heroically defended human rights during Argentina's military dictatorship (1976-1983), visiting political prisoners and documenting abuses.

xavier-l-pez-ancona.name: Xavier López Ancona
xavier-l-pez-ancona.bio: Xavier López Ancona (Jewish, Mexican), founder and chairman of KidZania, created one of the most innovative children's entertainment concepts, expanding from Mexico City to 25+ locations worldwide.

oskar-deutsch.name: Oskar Deutsch
oskar-deutsch.bio: Oskar Deutsch (Jewish), president of the IKG Wien, leads the Vienna Jewish community and advocates for Jewish interests in Austrian public life.

affiliations.organization: Israelitische Kultusgemeinde Wien (Jewish Community of Vienna)

anne-frank.name: Anne Frank
anne-frank.bio: Anne Frank (Jewish, 1929-1945), born in Frankfurt, fled with her family to Amsterdam. Hid for two years and wrote her famous diary before being discovered. Died in Bergen-Belsen. Her diary became one of the most-read books in history.

klara-ko-odziejska-deg-rska.name: Klara Kołodziejska-Degórska
klara-ko-odziejska-deg-rska.bio: Chief Rabbi of Poland (Progressive), one of the first female rabbis in Polish history.

affiliations.organization: Union of Jewish Communities in Poland

barbara-kirshenblatt-gimblett.name: Barbara Kirshenblatt-Gimblett
barbara-kirshenblatt-gimblett.bio: Professor at NYU who designed POLIN Museum's core exhibition on 1,000 years of Polish Jewish history.

affiliations.organization: POLIN Museum of the History of Polish Jews

piotr-cywi-ski.name: Piotr Cywiński
piotr-cywi-ski.bio: Director of the Auschwitz-Birkenau Memorial and Museum since 2006. Oversees preservation and education programs.

jonathan-ornstein.name: Jonathan Ornstein
jonathan-ornstein.bio: American-born executive director of the JCC Kraków since 2008, credited with revitalizing Jewish life in the city.

john-hamey.name: John Hamey

gideon-joffe.name: Gideon Joffe
gideon-joffe.bio: Chairman of the Jewish Community of Berlin (Jewish), the largest Jewish community in Germany.

affiliations.organization: Jüdische Gemeinde zu Berlin (Jewish Community of Berlin)

abraham-geiger.name: Abraham Geiger
abraham-geiger.bio: 19th-century German rabbi (Jewish) regarded as the founder of Reform Judaism. The college, founded in 1999, is named after him.

andreas-nachama.name: Andreas Nachama
andreas-nachama.bio: Chair of the Allgemeine Rabbinerkonferenz (Jewish), the General Rabbinical Conference of Germany.

philipp-peyman-engel.name: Philipp Peyman Engel
philipp-peyman-engel.bio: Editor-in-chief of the Jüdische Allgemeine (Jewish), Germany's main Jewish weekly newspaper.

aron-schuster.name: Aron Schuster
aron-schuster.bio: Director of the Zentralwohlfahrtsstelle (Jewish), the central welfare organization of Jews in Germany.

alon-meyer.name: Alon Meyer
alon-meyer.bio: President of Makkabi Deutschland (Jewish), organizing German Jewish athletes for the European Maccabi Games.

moses-mendelssohn.name: Moses Mendelssohn
moses-mendelssohn.bio: German-Jewish philosopher (1729-1786), the father of the Jewish Enlightenment (Haskalah). The center bears his name.

affiliations.organization: Moses Mendelssohn Center for European-Jewish Studies

leo-baeck.name: Leo Baeck
leo-baeck.bio: Rabbi Leo Baeck (1873-1956, Jewish), leader of German Jewry during the Nazi period, survived Theresienstadt. The institute preserves German-Jewish heritage.

g-nter-morsch.name: Günter Morsch
g-nter-morsch.bio: Former director of the Sachsenhausen Memorial, where over 200,000 people were imprisoned including many Jews.

eduard-knoblauch.name: Eduard Knoblauch
eduard-knoblauch.bio: Architect who designed the original Neue Synagoge (1866) in Moorish Revival style. It was damaged in Kristallnacht and WWII, later partially restored.

pinchas-goldschmidt.name: Pinchas Goldschmidt
pinchas-goldschmidt.bio: Former Chief Rabbi of Moscow (Jewish), served for over 30 years before leaving Russia in 2022 over the Ukraine invasion.

vladimir-potanin.name: Vladimir Potanin
vladimir-potanin.bio: Russian oligarch and president of Nornickel, the world's largest nickel and palladium producer. While not Jewish, has connections to Jewish business networks.

oleg-deripaska.name: Oleg Deripaska
oleg-deripaska.bio: Russian oligarch and founder of Rusal, the world's second-largest aluminum producer. His business dealings intersect with Jewish magnates.

adolf-shayevich.name: Adolf Shayevich
adolf-shayevich.bio: Chief Rabbi of Russia (Jewish), associated with the Moscow synagogues and Russian Jewish institutional life.

mark-grubarg.name: Mark Grubarg
mark-grubarg.bio: Chief Rabbi of St. Petersburg (Jewish), serving the Grand Choral Synagogue, built in 1893 in Moorish Revival style.

mikhail-chlenov.name: Mikhail Chlenov
mikhail-chlenov.bio: Russian-Jewish ethnographer and Secretary General of the Euro-Asian Jewish Congress.

jorge-knoblovits.name: Jorge Knoblovits
jorge-knoblovits.bio: President of DAIA (Jewish), Argentina's main Jewish political representation and anti-defamation organization.

alejandro-metzger.name: Alejandro Metzger
alejandro-metzger.bio: President of Sociedad Hebraica Argentina, Buenos Aires' largest Jewish community and sports club.

robert-cox.name: Robert Cox
robert-cox.bio: Legendary editor of the Buenos Aires Herald who exposed human rights abuses during Argentina's Dirty War.

affiliations.organization: Buenos Aires Herald / Jewish community media

ruth-kalenberg.name: Ruth Kalenberg
ruth-kalenberg.bio: Director of the Buenos Aires Jewish Museum, preserving the history of Argentina's 200,000-strong Jewish community.

adri-n-werthein.name: Adrián Werthein
adri-n-werthein.bio: Head of Grupo Werthein (Jewish), one of Argentina's most prominent business families with interests in telecom, banking, and agriculture.

graciela-jinich.name: Graciela Jinich
graciela-jinich.bio: Director of the Buenos Aires Holocaust Museum (Jewish), the first Holocaust museum in Latin America.

eduardo-barbero.name: Eduardo Barbero
eduardo-barbero.bio: Director of ORT Argentina (Jewish), operating one of the largest Jewish school networks in Latin America.

daniel-goldman.name: Daniel Goldman
daniel-goldman.bio: Rabbi of Beit El Congregation (Jewish), one of Buenos Aires' most prominent Conservative synagogues.

marcelo-polakoff.name: Marcelo Polakoff
marcelo-polakoff.bio: Rabbi of Templo Libertad (Jewish), Buenos Aires' oldest Ashkenazi synagogue, built in 1897.

claudio-lottenberg.name: Claudio Lottenberg
claudio-lottenberg.bio: President of CONIB (Jewish), the umbrella organization representing Brazil's 120,000 Jews.

fernando-lottenberg.name: Fernando Lottenberg
fernando-lottenberg.bio: Former president of FISESP (Jewish), who later served as Brazil's Special Envoy for Combating Antisemitism.

affiliations.organization: Federação Israelita do Estado de São Paulo (FISESP)

sidney-klajner.name: Sidney Klajner
sidney-klajner.bio: President of Hospital Israelita Albert Einstein. Leading physician and hospital administrator.

affiliations.organization: Albert Einstein Hospital (Hospital Israelita Albert Einstein)

carlos-matayoshi.name: Carlos Matayoshi
carlos-matayoshi.bio: President of Clube Hebraica São Paulo, one of the largest Jewish community clubs in Latin America.

felipe-arruda.name: Felipe Arruda
felipe-arruda.bio: Director of the Jewish Museum of São Paulo, opened in 2021 to document Jewish life in Brazil.

ruben-sternschein.name: Ruben Sternschein
ruben-sternschein.bio: Rabbi of Congregação Israelita Paulista (Jewish), one of the largest Reform congregations in Latin America.

daniela-riqueza.name: Daniela Riqueza
daniela-riqueza.bio: Director of the Jewish Museum of Rio de Janeiro, showcasing Jewish heritage in Brazil since 1977.

affiliations.organization: Museu Judaico do Rio de Janeiro

rowan-sobelvitch.name: Rowan Sobelvitch
rowan-sobelvitch.bio: National chairman of the South African Zionist Federation (Jewish), the oldest Zionist organization outside Europe.

peta-krost-maunder.name: Peta Krost Maunder
peta-krost-maunder.bio: Editor of the South African Jewish Report (Jewish), the community's main newspaper.

richard-memory.name: Richard Memory
richard-memory.bio: Director of the Cape Town Holocaust & Genocide Centre, combining Holocaust education with genocide awareness.

ariellah-rosenberg.name: Ariellah Rosenberg
ariellah-rosenberg.bio: National Director of ORT South Africa (Jewish), providing education and training programs.

koos-bekker.name: Koos Bekker
koos-bekker.bio: Former CEO and chairman of Naspers, who transformed it from a South African newspaper group into a global tech investor (Tencent, etc.). Not Jewish, but the company was founded by Afrikaner interests.

tali-nates.name: Tali Nates
tali-nates.bio: Founder and director of the Johannesburg Holocaust & Genocide Centre (Jewish, child of Holocaust survivors).

rabbi-harris.name: Rabbi Harris
rabbi-harris.bio: Principal associated with King David Schools (Jewish), the largest Jewish day school network in South Africa.

marc-sobel.name: Marc Sobel
marc-sobel.bio: Former principal of Herzlia School (Jewish), Cape Town's leading Jewish day school.

ben-memory.name: Ben Memory
ben-memory.bio: Chairman of South African Friends of Israel, advocating for Israel within South Africa.

solomon-sopher.name: Solomon Sopher
solomon-sopher.bio: Leader of the Bene Israel community (Jewish) and figure in the Central Jewish Board of India.

isaac-elia-jhirad.name: Isaac Elia Jhirad
isaac-elia-jhirad.bio: Prominent Bene Israel leader (Jewish) who served as surgeon-general in the Indian Army and advocated for the community.

jacob-sassoon.name: Jacob Sassoon
jacob-sassoon.bio: Built Knesset Eliyahoo Synagogue (1884) in Mumbai. Part of the Baghdadi Jewish Sassoon family who built an empire in India.

sarah-cohen.name: Sarah Cohen
sarah-cohen.bio: One of the last surviving Paradesi Jews (White Jews) of Cochin, whose community dates to ancient times in Kerala.

elijah-judah.name: Elijah Judah
elijah-judah.bio: Community figure associated with preserving the heritage of the Bene Israel, India's largest Jewish group with a 2,000+ year history.

marcos-shabot.name: Marcos Shabot
marcos-shabot.bio: President of the Comité Central de la Comunidad Judía de México (Jewish), representing Mexico's 50,000 Jews.

affiliations.organization: Comité Central de la Comunidad Judía de México

laura-goldsmith.name: Laura Goldsmith
laura-goldsmith.bio: Director of Tribuna Israelita (Jewish), combating antisemitism and promoting dialogue in Mexico.

emilio-azc-rraga-jean.name: Emilio Azcárraga Jean
emilio-azc-rraga-jean.bio: Former chairman of Grupo Televisa, the largest media company in the Spanish-speaking world. Has business connections with Jewish entrepreneurs.

mois-s-saad.name: Moisés Saad
mois-s-saad.bio: Director of Colegio Hebreo Maguen David (Jewish), one of Mexico City's largest Jewish schools, serving the Syrian community.

sharon-zaga.name: Sharon Zaga
sharon-zaga.bio: President and founder of the Museo Memoria y Tolerancia (Jewish), Mexico City's Holocaust and tolerance museum.

andr-s-heisler.name: András Heisler
andr-s-heisler.bio: President of Mazsihisz (Jewish), representing Hungary's approximately 100,000 Jews, the largest community in Central Europe.

lajos-kossuth.name: Lajos Kossuth
lajos-kossuth.bio: Designed by architect Ludwig Förster in 1854-59, with support from the Kossuth-era Hungarian liberal movement. Largest synagogue in Europe.

zsuzsanna-toronyi.name: Zsuzsanna Toronyi
zsuzsanna-toronyi.bio: Director of the Hungarian Jewish Museum and Archives (Jewish), located within the Dohány Street Synagogue complex.

can-togay.name: Can Togay
can-togay.bio: Film director who conceived the Shoes on the Danube Bank memorial (2005) with sculptor Gyula Pauer, honoring 3,500 Jews shot into the Danube.

andr-s-kov-cs.name: András Kovács
andr-s-kov-cs.bio: Sociologist and scholar (Jewish) leading efforts to preserve Hungary's vast Jewish architectural and cultural heritage.

anna-szeszler.name: Anna Szeszler
anna-szeszler.bio: Director of ORT Hungary, providing education and training in the tradition of the global ORT network.

barbara-staudinger.name: Barbara Staudinger
barbara-staudinger.bio: Director of the Jewish Museum Vienna (2022-), showcasing 1,000 years of Jewish life in Austria.

barbara-gl-ck.name: Barbara Glück
barbara-gl-ck.bio: Director of the Mauthausen Memorial, where approximately 90,000 people were murdered, including many Jews.

joseph-kornh-usel.name: Joseph Kornhäusel
joseph-kornh-usel.bio: Architect who designed the Stadttempel (1826), Vienna's only synagogue to survive Kristallnacht because it was hidden within a residential block.

binyomin-jacobs.name: Binyomin Jacobs
binyomin-jacobs.bio: Chief Rabbi of the Netherlands (Jewish), spiritual leader of the Dutch Ashkenazi Jewish community.

elias-bouman.name: Elias Bouman
elias-bouman.bio: Architect who designed the Portuguese Synagogue of Amsterdam (1675), built by Sephardic Jews who fled the Inquisition.

emile-schrijver.name: Emile Schrijver
emile-schrijver.bio: General Director of the Jewish Cultural Quarter Amsterdam (Jewish), including the Jewish Historical Museum.

etty-hillesum.name: Etty Hillesum
etty-hillesum.bio: Dutch Jewish writer whose letters and diaries from Westerbork, before her murder at Auschwitz, became celebrated Holocaust literature.

yohan-benizri.name: Yohan Benizri
yohan-benizri.bio: President of the CCOJB (Jewish), coordinating Belgium's Jewish organizations.

affiliations.organization: Coordinating Committee of Jewish Organisations in Belgium (CCOJB)

pascale-falek.name: Pascale Falek
pascale-falek.bio: Director of the Jewish Museum of Belgium, which was targeted in a deadly terror attack in 2014.

christoph-busch.name: Christoph Busch
christoph-busch.bio: Director of Kazerne Dossin, the memorial at the former transit camp from which 25,000 Jews were deported to Auschwitz.

pinchas-kornfeld.name: Pinchas Kornfeld
pinchas-kornfeld.bio: Chief Rabbi and leader of one of Europe's most Orthodox Jewish communities, centered in Antwerp's diamond district.

ralph-lewin.name: Ralph Lewin
ralph-lewin.bio: President of the Swiss Federation of Jewish Communities (Jewish), representing 18,000 Jews in Switzerland.

tedros-adhanom-ghebreyesus.name: Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus
tedros-adhanom-ghebreyesus.bio: Director-General of WHO. Israel has advanced medical collaborations with WHO through its health tech innovations.

daniel-mariaschin.name: Daniel Mariaschin
daniel-mariaschin.bio: CEO of B'nai B'rith International (Jewish), the oldest Jewish service organization (1843), with its UN office in Geneva.

jean-fran-ois-bergier.name: Jean-François Bergier
jean-fran-ois-bergier.bio: Swiss historian who chaired the Independent Commission of Experts (1996-2002) investigating Switzerland's WWII-era dealings with Nazi Germany and dormant Jewish accounts.

peter-maurer.name: Peter Maurer
peter-maurer.bio: Former president of the ICRC. The ICRC's controversial WWII role - failing to intervene for Jews - led to formal apologies and study.

affiliations.organization: International Committee of the Red Cross (Jewish relationship)

noemi-di-segni.name: Noemi Di Segni
noemi-di-segni.bio: President of the Union of Italian Jewish Communities (UCEI) (Jewish), representing approximately 25,000 Italian Jews.

alessandra-di-castro.name: Alessandra Di Castro
alessandra-di-castro.bio: Director of the Jewish Museum of Rome, documenting Europe's oldest continuous Jewish community (since 161 BCE).

riccardo-di-segni.name: Riccardo Di Segni
riccardo-di-segni.bio: Chief Rabbi of Rome (Jewish), spiritual leader at the Great Synagogue (Tempio Maggiore), built in 1904.

shaul-bassi.name: Shaul Bassi
shaul-bassi.bio: Scholar and director of the Venice Center for Humanities and Social Change (Jewish), who has studied the Venice Ghetto - the world's first Jewish ghetto (1516).

joseph-levi.name: Joseph Levi
joseph-levi.bio: Rabbi of the Jewish community of Florence (Jewish), overseeing the Moorish Revival-style Tempio Maggiore (1882).

vincenza-maugeri.name: Vincenza Maugeri
vincenza-maugeri.bio: Director of the Jewish Museum of Bologna, documenting Jewish life in the Emilia-Romagna region since medieval times.

marco-impagliazzo.name: Marco Impagliazzo
marco-impagliazzo.bio: President of the Community of Sant'Egidio, which has led Catholic-Jewish interfaith dialogue since 1986.

isaac-querub.name: Isaac Querub
isaac-querub.bio: President of the Federation of Jewish Communities of Spain (Jewish), representing approximately 40,000-50,000 Jews.

affiliations.organization: Federation of Jewish Communities of Spain (additional)
Federation of Jewish Communities of Spain

samuel-ha-levi-abulafia.name: Samuel ha-Levi Abulafia
samuel-ha-levi-abulafia.bio: 14th-century treasurer to King Peter I of Castile (Jewish) who built the Synagogue of El Tránsito (1357), now the Sephardic Museum.

moses-maimonides.name: Moses Maimonides
moses-maimonides.bio: Born in Córdoba in 1138, Maimonides was the greatest medieval Jewish philosopher. A statue stands near the synagogue in the old Jewish quarter.

esther-bendahan.name: Esther Bendahan
esther-bendahan.bio: Director general of Casa Sefarad-Israel (Jewish), promoting Sephardic culture and Spain-Israel relations.

jakub-nowakowski.name: Jakub Nowakowski
jakub-nowakowski.bio: Director of the Galicia Jewish Museum in Kraków (Jewish), showcasing the rich Jewish heritage of Galicia.

zygmunt-st-pi-ski.name: Zygmunt Stępiński
zygmunt-st-pi-ski.bio: Director of POLIN Museum, the award-winning museum documenting 1,000 years of Polish Jewish history.

affiliations.organization: Museum of the History of Polish Jews (POLIN) - additional programs

tomasz-kranz.name: Tomasz Kranz
tomasz-kranz.bio: Director of the Majdanek State Museum, where approximately 78,000 people were murdered including 59,000 Jews.

edward-kop-wka.name: Edward Kopówka
edward-kop-wka.bio: Director of the Museum of Struggle and Martyrdom in Treblinka, where approximately 800,000 Jews were murdered.

mordechai-anielewicz.name: Mordechai Anielewicz
mordechai-anielewicz.bio: Commander of the Warsaw Ghetto Uprising (April 1943, Jewish), the largest Jewish revolt against the Nazis. Killed at age 24.

izaak-malmed.name: Izaak Malmed
izaak-malmed.bio: Rabbi associated with the historic Tykocin Synagogue (1642), one of the best-preserved Baroque synagogues in Poland.

leo-pavl-t.name: Leo Pavlát
leo-pavl-t.bio: Former director of the Jewish Museum in Prague (Jewish), one of the oldest and most visited Jewish museums in the world.

rabbi-judah-loew-ben-bezalel.name: Rabbi Judah Loew ben Bezalel
rabbi-judah-loew-ben-bezalel.bio: The Maharal of Prague (c. 1520-1609, Jewish), legendary rabbi buried in the Old Jewish Cemetery, associated with the Golem legend.

ji-fiedler.name: Jiří Fiedler
ji-fiedler.bio: Czech researcher and documenter of Jewish heritage sites, whose work helped catalog the 77,297 names inscribed on the synagogue walls.

jan-munk.name: Jan Munk
jan-munk.bio: Director of the Terezín Memorial, commemorating the ghetto/transit camp where 33,000 Jews died and 88,000 were deported to death camps.

boris-lozhkin.name: Boris Lozhkin
boris-lozhkin.bio: President of the Jewish Confederation of Ukraine (Jewish), businessman and former head of the Presidential Administration of Ukraine.

natan-sharansky.name: Natan Sharansky
natan-sharansky.bio: Former Soviet dissident, Israeli politician (Jewish), and chairman of the Babyn Yar Holocaust Memorial Center supervisory board.

meylakh-sheykhet.name: Meylakh Sheykhet
meylakh-sheykhet.bio: Representative of the Union of Jewish Religious Organizations of Ukraine, active in heritage preservation.

isaac-ben-nachman.name: Isaac ben Nachman
isaac-ben-nachman.bio: Builder of the original Golden Rose Synagogue (1582) in Lviv, one of the earliest stone synagogues in Eastern Europe. Destroyed by Nazis in 1943.

naim-g-lery-z.name: Naim Güleryüz
naim-g-lery-z.bio: Historian and author (Jewish, Turkish) who documented the 500-year history of Turkish Jewry since the 1492 Spanish expulsion.

i-shak-haleva.name: İshak Haleva
i-shak-haleva.bio: Hakham Bashi (Chief Rabbi) of Turkey (Jewish), spiritual leader of the Turkish Jewish community.

bayezid-ii.name: Bayezid II
bayezid-ii.bio: Ottoman Sultan who welcomed Sephardic Jews expelled from Spain in 1492, famously saying Ferdinand of Spain made his own country poor.

zhor-rehihil.name: Zhor Rehihil
zhor-rehihil.bio: Curator of the Museum of Moroccan Judaism (Muslim), the only Jewish museum in the Arab world, demonstrating Moroccan interfaith respect.

serge-berdugo.name: Serge Berdugo
serge-berdugo.bio: Secretary-General of the Council of Jewish Communities of Morocco (Jewish), ambassador-at-large.

affiliations.organization: Conseil des Communautes Israelites du Maroc
Conseil des Communautés Israélites du Maroc

rabbi-haim-pinto.name: Rabbi Haim Pinto
rabbi-haim-pinto.bio: 18th-century Moroccan rabbi (Jewish) revered as a miracle worker; his yahrzeit draws thousands of pilgrims to Essaouira.

aron-verst-ndig.name: Aron Verständig
aron-verst-ndig.bio: Chairman of the Official Council of Swedish Jewish Communities (Jewish), representing approximately 15,000 Swedish Jews.

affiliations.organization: Official Council of Swedish Jewish Communities

petra-kahn-nord.name: Petra Kahn Nord
petra-kahn-nord.bio: Director of the Jewish Museum in Stockholm, documenting Jewish life in Sweden since the 18th century.

ute-steyer.name: Ute Steyer
ute-steyer.bio: Rabbi of the Great Synagogue of Stockholm (Jewish), serving Sweden's largest Jewish community.

dan-rosenberg-asmussen.name: Dan Rosenberg Asmussen
dan-rosenberg-asmussen.bio: Chairman of the Jewish Community of Denmark (Jewish), representing approximately 6,000 Danish Jews.

yair-melchior.name: Yair Melchior
yair-melchior.bio: Chief Rabbi of Denmark (Jewish), spiritual leader of the Danish Jewish community.

georg-ferdinand-duckwitz.name: Georg Ferdinand Duckwitz
georg-ferdinand-duckwitz.bio: German diplomat who warned Danish Jews of the planned Nazi roundup in October 1943, enabling the rescue of 7,200 Jews by boat to Sweden.

ervin-kohn.name: Ervin Kohn
ervin-kohn.bio: President of the Jewish Community of Oslo (Jewish), representing Norway's approximately 1,500 Jews.

guri-hjeltnes.name: Guri Hjeltnes
guri-hjeltnes.bio: Director associated with documenting Norway's Jewish history, including the deportation of Norwegian Jews during WWII.

affiliations.organization: Center for Studies of the Holocaust and Religious Minorities (HL-senteret)

yaron-nadbornik.name: Yaron Nadbornik
yaron-nadbornik.bio: Chairman of the Central Council of Jewish Communities in Finland (Jewish), representing approximately 1,300 Finnish Jews.

affiliations.organization: Central Council of Jewish Communities in Finland

david-saltiel.name: David Saltiel
david-saltiel.bio: President of the Central Board of Jewish Communities in Greece (Jewish), representing approximately 5,000 Greek Jews.

affiliations.organization: Central Board of Jewish Communities in Greece
Central Board of Jewish Communities in Greece (KIS)

zanet-battinou.name: Zanet Battinou
zanet-battinou.bio: Director of the Jewish Museum of Greece in Athens, documenting 2,300 years of Greek Jewish (Romaniote) history.

erika-perahia-zemour.name: Erika Perahia-Zemour
erika-perahia-zemour.bio: Director of the Jewish Museum of Thessaloniki (Jewish), documenting the city once known as 'Mother of Israel' for its vast Jewish population.

yitzchak-kerem.name: Yitzchak Kerem
yitzchak-kerem.bio: Scholar of Greek Jewish history. The memorial honors 50,000 Thessaloniki Jews deported to Auschwitz in 1943 - 96% of the community.

marcia-haddad-ikonomopoulos.name: Marcia Haddad Ikonomopoulos
marcia-haddad-ikonomopoulos.bio: Founder of Kehila Kedosha Janina (Jewish), the only Romaniote synagogue in the Western Hemisphere, in New York.

jos-oulman-carp.name: José Oulman Carp
jos-oulman-carp.bio: President of the Jewish Community of Lisbon (Jewish), representing Portugal's approximately 3,000 Jews.

captain-barros-basto.name: Captain Barros Basto
captain-barros-basto.bio: Portuguese army officer (Jewish) who led the 'Rescue' movement to reconnect crypto-Jews (Bnei Anusim) with Judaism in the 1920s-30s.

samuel-schwarz.name: Samuel Schwarz
samuel-schwarz.bio: Jewish-Polish mining engineer who in 1917 discovered the crypto-Jewish community of Belmonte, which had secretly practiced Judaism for 500 years.

homayoun-sameyah-najafabadi.name: Homayoun Sameyah Najafabadi
homayoun-sameyah-najafabadi.bio: Jewish member of the Iranian Majlis (parliament), holding the constitutionally guaranteed seat for the Jewish community.

avraham-neguise.name: Avraham Neguise
avraham-neguise.bio: Ethiopian-born Israeli politician (Jewish), first Ethiopian-born member of the Knesset, advocate for Ethiopian Jewish rights.

qes-hadane.name: Qes Hadane
qes-hadane.bio: One of the last kessim (Bete Israel religious leaders) who served the North Shewa community before emigration.

uri-lubrani.name: Uri Lubrani
uri-lubrani.bio: Israeli diplomat (Jewish) who coordinated Operation Solomon, the dramatic 36-hour airlift of 14,325 Ethiopian Jews in 1991.

binyamin-edery.name: Binyamin Edery
binyamin-edery.bio: Chabad rabbi serving the Jewish community of Japan, based in Tokyo.

anatole-ponevejsky.name: Anatole Ponevejsky
anatole-ponevejsky.bio: Leader of the Kobe Jewish community (Jewcom) during WWII who helped coordinate aid for Jewish refugees transiting through Japan.

chen-jian.name: Chen Jian
chen-jian.bio: Former curator of the Shanghai Jewish Refugees Museum, documenting the stories of 20,000 Jewish refugees.

shi-lei.name: Shi Lei
shi-lei.bio: One of the Kaifeng Jewish descendants who reconnected with Judaism and made aliyah to Israel.

sir-victor-sassoon.name: Sir Victor Sassoon
sir-victor-sassoon.bio: Jewish businessman of Baghdadi origin, built the Cathay Hotel (now Fairmont Peace Hotel) and was one of the wealthiest men in Asia.

sir-jacob-elias-sassoon.name: Sir Jacob Elias Sassoon
sir-jacob-elias-sassoon.bio: Jewish businessman of Baghdadi origin who built the Ohel Rachel Synagogue (1920), the largest synagogue in East Asia.

gustavo-kraselnik.name: Gustavo Kraselnik
gustavo-kraselnik.bio: Former president of the Panama Jewish community, editor of Shalom Panama magazine.

ricardo-lackner.name: Ricardo Lackner
ricardo-lackner.bio: Former president of the Comité Central Israelita del Uruguay (Jewish).

gerardo-gorodischer.name: Gerardo Gorodischer
gerardo-gorodischer.bio: President of the Comunidad Judía de Chile (Jewish), representing 18,000 Chilean Jews.

marco-peckel.name: Marco Peckel
marco-peckel.bio: Former president of the Confederación de Comunidades Judías de Colombia (Jewish).

affiliations.organization: Confederación de Comunidades Judías de Colombia

juliet-moses.name: Juliet Moses
juliet-moses.bio: Spokesperson for the New Zealand Jewish Council (Jewish), prominent advocate against antisemitism.

silviu-vexler.name: Silviu Vexler
silviu-vexler.bio: Jewish member of the Romanian Parliament, holding the dedicated minority seat, active in Holocaust remembrance.

affiliations.organization: Federation of Jewish Communities in Romania
Federation of Jewish Communities in Romania

dennis-leventhal.name: Dennis Leventhal
dennis-leventhal.bio: Founder and president of the Jewish Historical Society of Hong Kong, documenting 175 years of Jewish life.

affiliations.organization: Jewish Historical Society of Hong Kong

michael-kadoorie.name: Michael Kadoorie
michael-kadoorie.bio: Sir Michael Kadoorie (Jewish, Baghdadi origin), billionaire businessman and patron of the Ohel Leah Synagogue in Hong Kong.

adela-dworin.name: Adela Dworin
adela-dworin.bio: Longtime president of Havana's Jewish community (Jewish), keeping the community alive through decades of the Castro era.

affiliations.organization: Patronato de la Casa de la Comunidad Hebrea de Cuba

alexander-wandersman.name: Alexander Wandersman
alexander-wandersman.bio: Community leader of the Nairobi Hebrew Congregation, serving East Africa's small Jewish community.

ahmed-el-tayeb.name: Ahmed el-Tayeb
ahmed-el-tayeb.bio: Grand Imam of Al-Azhar who co-signed the Document on Human Fraternity, inspiring the Abrahamic Family House.

elli-kriel.name: Elli Kriel
elli-kriel.bio: South African-born chef (Jewish) who pioneered Dubai's kosher dining scene, creating 'Elli's Kosher Kitchen.'

affiliations.organization: Kosher restaurants and community in Dubai

maurice-cohen.name: Maurice Cohen
maurice-cohen.bio: Former president of the Jewish Representative Council of Ireland, representing approximately 2,500 Irish Jews.

chaim-herzog.name: Chaim Herzog
chaim-herzog.bio: 6th President of Israel (1983-1993, Jewish), born in Belfast and raised in Dublin; his father was Chief Rabbi of Ireland.

ognjen-kraus.name: Ognjen Kraus
